The Sneezy Dragon - A New York City-based chain of artisanal ice cream shops with a unique twist: all of their flavors are inspired by the seven dragons from the popular children's book series "How to Train Your Dragon." Customers can choose from flavors like "Snotlout's Sea Salt Caramel," "Gobber's Ginger Cookie Dough," and "Hiccup's Honey Lavender." Each flavor is carefully crafted to capture the essence of the dragon it's named after, and the shops are designed to resemble a dragon's lair. Confidence score: 0.9

The Sneezy Dragon - A mobile app that uses augmented reality technology to bring the dragons of "How to Train Your Dragon" to life in the real world. Users can point their phone at any location and see the dragons appear in their surroundings, complete with animations and sound effects. The app also includes games and challenges that allow users to interact with the dragons and earn rewards. Confidence score: 0.8

The Sneezy Dragon - A line of Sneezy-themed merchandise, including plush toys, t-shirts, and hats. Each item is designed to resemble the dragons from the book series, and a portion of the proceeds from each sale goes to support conservation efforts for endangered species. Confidence score: 0.7

The Sneezy Dragon - A subscription box service that delivers a new selection of dragon-themed items each month, including artwork, collectibles, and craft supplies. The items are carefully curated to appeal to fans of all ages, and the subscription service helps to support the creators of "How to Train Your Dragon" and other related projects. Confidence score: 0.6

The Sneezy Dragon - A virtual reality experience that allows users to soar through the skies with the dragons of "How to Train Your Dragon." The experience is available at designated VR centers, and users can choose from a variety of dragons to ride, including Toothless, Stormfly, and the other dragons from the series. Confidence score: 0.5
